name: ollama-autopilot
description: Local LLM inline code completion using Ollama.

ollama-autopilot.general.autocompleteDel.description: Delay in milliseconds before triggering autocomplete

ollama-autopilot.general.snoozeTimeMin.description: Time in minutes the Ollama Autopilot will snooze its autocomplete before resuming

ollama-autopilot.model.maxAutocompleteTo.description: Maximum number of tokens for autocomplete

ollama-autopilot.model.modelKeepAliveTim.description: Time in minutes the model should remain loaded in memory (use -1 for unlimited)

ollama-autopilot.prompt.textBeforeCursor.description: Number of text characters before the cursor that should be considered (keep your models context size in mind)

ollama-autopilot.prompt.textAfterCursorS.description: Number of text characters after the cursor that should be considered (keep your models context size in mind; default prompt does not use this)

ollama-autopilot.prompt.promptText.default:
You are an inline code completion engine. 
Continue the following ${languageId} code exactly as a developer would type next. 

Rules: 
- Output only the code continuation 
- Do not repeat or modify existing code 
- Do not add comments, imports, or explanations 
- Match the existing style, formatting, and indentation 
- Keep the completion short and stop early 

Existing code: 
${textBeforeCursor}
ollama-autopilot.prompt.promptText.description: Prompt text. You can use the following template literals in your prompt: ${projectName}, ${fileName}, ${languageId}, ${textBeforeCursor}, ${textAfterCursor}

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
